titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eldon Dedini Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stephen Maxwell

publicationstmt.publisher: The Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Stephen Maxwell and Wendy Pflug using the OhioLINK EAD Application in 2015

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: The Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum

did.abstract: This collection contains books, comic books, original art and papers of cartoonist, Eldon Dedini (1921-2006)

bioghist.head: Biography of Eldon Dedini
bioghist.p: Eldon Dedini was born on June 21, 1921. He grew up in rural California on a ranch in King City. Eldon knew from an early age that he wanted to be a cartoonist and received support from his family to pursue his dream. In high school he drew cartoons for two local newspapers without payment in order to gain experience. While at Salinas Junior College, he sold his first cartoon to Esquire. After graduation he furthered his art education at Chouinard Institute of Art in Los Angeles. He married classmate, painter Virginia Conroy after their graduation in 1944. They adopted son, Giulio in 1960. He began his career at Universal Studios and then as a storyboard writer for Disney and worked on films such as "Mickey and the Beanstalk." In 1946 the editor of Esquire recognized his potential and offered Dedini double his salary to work exclusively for the magazine, generating ideas for other cartoonists as well as creating cartoons himself. In 1950, Dedini began to submit cartoons to the New Yorker and soon became one the magazine's contract artists, which gave the publication first choice of cartoons. Hugh Hefner, the creator of Playboy, was a fan of Dedini's work and asked him for a few years to work for Playboy and was eventually able to convince him to join after Esquire was sold in 1959. Most issues of Playboy featured at least one full-page color cartoon beginning in 1959. Dedini continued to draw for Playboy and the New Yorker, as well as freelance for many other national publications until his death on January 12, 2006.
Dedini was recognized by the National Cartoonists Society as winner of Gag Cartoonist of the Year award in 1958, 1961, 1964, and 1988.

Eldon was also very active in giving back to his community. He was a founding member of the group that helped to restore Cannery Row to its former glory and continue its preservation. He also was an active volunteer for his church, All Saints Episcopal Church, creating the comic strip "Brother Larry" for the newsletter as well has helping out in the kitchen on Christmas. He passed away at age 84 on January 12, 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection was inventoried by Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum staff in 2006, which produced a box level inventory. The collection was processed using the MPLP approach (More Product, Less Process). As such the physical arrangement of the collection was left in the order that it was originally packaged, while an intellectual order of the contents, organizing the collection into thirteen series, has been imposed. The corresponding box level information is included in the inventory guide, but note that the materials are loosely arranged in the boxes and represents the order of which Dedini originally stored his files at the Carmel, California home. This collection contains a variety of Dedini's work including original cartoon art from Playboy, The New Yorker, Esquire, and other national publications, advertising, book illustrations, and freelance work. It also contains his roughs and sketches, his research files, information on the professional and charitable organizations that he belonged to, correspondence, personal materials, and memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is broken into thirteen series. The first three series, Playboy, New Yorker, and Esquire have sub-series. More information on the contents can be found in the container list.

list.item: Sub-Series 2: New Yorker Sketches and Roughs, 1970-2002
Series VII: Sketches, Drawings, and Scrapbooks, 1950-2005
Series X: Professional and Charitable Organizations, 1960s-2005, Undated
Series XII: Personal and Family Materials, 1921-2006, Undated

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Original art by Eldon Dedini has been separated out and cataloged at the item level in the Original Art Database

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
Works by Eldon Dedini have been cataloged in The Ohio State University Libraries catalog under "Dedini, Eldon." Books owned by Dedini, which often feature his illustrations have been cataloged under the title "Eldon Dedini Collection."Also available in the libraries catalog are published issues of magazines such as Esquire and the New Yorker with Dedini's works.
Miscellaneous clippings about Dedini may be found in the library's biography file under his last name.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried by Jenny Robb in 2006, and minimally processed by Caitlin Naber in 2012 and by Stephen Maxwell in 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions for materials in this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: All copyright laws pertain to any use or reproduction of published materials in the collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Box Number/Folder Number], Eldon Dedini Papers, The Ohio State University, Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Eldon Dedini, 2006. Later accessions to the collection were given by Giulio Dedini in 2007 and 2009.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The collection was assembled, owned, and maintained by Eldon Dedini.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: This series contains information on Dedini's work for Playboy. It is further divided into two sub-series: Correspondence and Sketches and Roughs. The first sub-series includes letter from Playboy Cartoon editor, Michelle Urry, and magazine founder Hugh Hefner. The second sub-series contains sketches and roughs of cartoons drawn for the publication.

did.unittitle: Playboy - Correspondence with Hugh Hefner and Michelle Urry (9 Folders)

scopecontent.p: This series contains information on his work for the New Yorker. It is further divided into two sub-series: Correspondence and Sketches and Roughs. The first sub-series includes correspondence with the magazine's editors. The second sub-series contains sketches and roughs of cartoons drawn for the publication.

The first sub-series includes correspondence with the magazine's editors. The second sub-series contains sketches and roughs of cartoons drawn for the publication.

scopecontent.p: This series contains advertising work that Dedini created for various companies. There is a significant amount of work for Mann Packing beginning in the 1980s, for which he created the character Broccoli Wokly. Although many materials in the series are undated it is presumed they were created throughout Dedini's career, 1940s-2000s.

scopecontent.p: This series contains the original art work by Eldon Dedini it has been described on the items level in the original art database. To view catalog records of the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum holdings of Eldon Dedini's original art work, please see the Original Art Database.

This is the largest series in the collection and contains all of Dedini's resource materials for research purposes. Dedini was a voracious reader throughout his career and looked to newspapers, magazines, and books to inspire his cartoons. There is a large amount of research files for wine, Russia, Playboy, and the New Yorker. Books, magazines, other published materials from Dedini's library can also be found in The Ohio State University Libraries

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to any organizations that he was a part of, both professional and charitable. There's a good amount from the National Cartoonist Society and Cannery Row, which he played a role in helping restore.

scopecontent.p: This series contains memorabilia associated with Dedini. This includes tools he used to create his cartoons, inspiration material from his childhood, and even a gilded baby shoe that his mother kept with his name on the bottom.

scopecontent.p: Note written on folder by Eldon Dedini: "Virginia and her family knew Johnny Cannon (Disney animator). When Virginia's mother died I cleaned out her garage and found packages of model sheets, story sketches, misc.etc. Much water damaged- others good shape."
